Wikipedia contains 5,976,472 pages.
There are a total of 484,533,890 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,924,901 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"Index of Singapore-related articles" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (10,484).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,095).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,897).
"List of film director and composer collaborations" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (6,651).
"List of political ideologies" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,353).
"International Standard Book Number" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,106,551 incoming links).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,104,701 incoming links).
"WorldCat" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (605,255 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (602,520 incoming links).
"Library of Congress Control Number" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (480,387 incoming links).
The first Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "!!".
The last Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "ùïä".
318 Wikipedia pages (0.005% of all pages) have no incoming or outgoing links.
There are only 1,341 Wikipedia pages (0.02% of all pages) which link to no other pages.
There are 314,151 Wikipedia pages (5.26% of all pages) which are not linked to from any other page.

Only 19 Wikipedia page titles begin with an exclamation mark, one of which is "!O!ung_language".
9,155 Wikipedia pages (0.15%) have a title which contains an exclamation mark.
Only 16 Wikipedia page titles begin with a question mark, one of which is "?:_A_Question_Mark".
3,848 Wikipedia pages (0.06%) have a title which contains a question mark.
5,198,478 Wikipedia pages (87.0%) have a title which contains a space.
777,994 Wikipedia pages (13.0%) have a title which does not contain a space.
A single or double quotation mark can be found in 177,290 Wikipedia page titles (2.97% of all page titles), leading to countless parsing issues while creating this.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.
The "Order of magnitude" page lists "yocto-" (10^-24) and "yotta-" (10^24) as the smallest and largest magnitude prefixes.
The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
An "Illegal prime" is a prime number that represents information whose possession or distribution is forbidden in some legal jurisdictions.
